729115f-a.text:
Manor Road, west side, about 900 yards south of Brielle Avenue, showing a tranquil scene on the 17-acre T. L. Meinikheim farm. The property later became part of
the Sea View Hospital.
About 1910
Views 1-2
By Mulford Simonson
From P. L. Sperr Collection

n.d.

48(482
729105f-a.folder: Manor Road & Brielle Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729112f-a.text:
Manor Road, west side, 350 yards south of Brielle ..venue, showing the old Egbert House, dating back to colonial days. The house later belonged to J. Wood (Buller's 1853 map); to White (Beers's 1874 and 1887 maps); to Theodore Siersema (Robinson's 1898 map), and to David Kaplan (1907 Robinson map). The 1917 map shows it to be on the land of Sea View Hospital. Mr. P. L. Sperr, who photographed other views of this house, states that the house was being used as the sheepherder's
cottage of the hospital.
1920's
Ewing Galloway
729112f-a.folder: Manor Road & Brielle Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729114f-a.text:
(1)
Manor Road, west side, 350 yards south of Brielle Avenue, showing the old Egbert House, dating back to colonial days. It passed into the hands of J. Wood, according to Butler's 1853 map, and to White, according to Beers's maps of 1874 and 1887. Still later it became the property of Theodore Siersema, and David Kaplan, as indicated in the Robinson atlases of 1898 and 1907, respectively. Mr. P. L. Sperr states that the house was being used as the sheepherder's cottage of Sea View Hospital, at the time this photograph was taken. T)is view showa the east
side and rear of the house.
1924
P. L. Sperr
(2)
A full front view of the house.
October 4, 1925
P. L. Sperr
(3) The front and east side of the house.
October 4, 1925
P. L. Sperr
729114f-a.folder: Manor Road & Brielle Avenue, Staten Island, NY
